Please excuse the mess. New Guide Coming in August 2015.

Introduction

This research guide was produced for Professor Kerry Tripp's Spring 2013 "Legal Aspects of Family Problems" class (FMSC 487). It supplements the April 2, 2013 legal research session of the class. Others may find it useful for their own legal research purposes. It may be updated to account for class needs, or for changes in the print and digital resources mentioned.

If you have any questions about this guide or if you need additional legal research assistance, feel free to reach out to Pablo Sandoval.

Resources Used in this Guide

This guide relies heavily on digital research tools. It also limits itself to resources available to the University of Maryland-College Park community. In particular, it points to the Westlaw and LexisNexis databases to which the College Park campus subscribes for research and instructional purposes. 

During the course of your research, you may click on a link that results in a screen like this one in Westlaw:

If you come across this screen or one like it in other databases, it means that the library doesn't subscribe to the resource that you're trying to access. If this happens, feel free to ask Pablo Sandoval about other ways to get to the information you want.
